statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content:
Garfield enjoys learns idioms very much. There is an interesting kind of idiom of chinese, and we call it ��Ъ����". Garfield has a list of this idioms, but the format is awful. Garfield is not very smart, you should use the program to help him to tidy up the idioms.
  The standard formt of an idiom here is ��A����B��, for example, ���������ϡ��������Կ�". But now there are three awful situations you need to deal with:
1)sometimes there is a pair of chinese brackets in the expression to explain something, and you need to omit the brackets and contexts between them. For example, �����Ϲ����ơ����ճ�������".

2)sometimes there are several Bs for the unique A, and two Bs are separated by chinese semicolons. You need to slip the idiom, for each B. For example, ���鲼������ĵ�������䲻�ϣ�����".

3)sometimes the dash between A and B is took place by chinese comma, and you need to change them into dash. For example, �����������ӣ������ѱ�".

But sometimes both the dash and the comma exit in the idiom, then we define it that the dash is just the separator for A and B.

statement.title: Input
statement.content: There is a integer N(1<N<10000) indicating the number of the list to deal. Then N lines follows, each line contain an idiom, and the length of every idiom isn��t beyond 200.

statement.title: Output
statement.content:
Int first line, output the number of the list you get. Then put the result you calculate. You should sort the list according to the length of idioms, then the lexicographical places.

Hint
